"The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo" is a fantastic choice! I'm so glad you loved it! Taylor Jenkins Reid's writing is captivating, and Evelyn Hugo's story is a sweeping romance that explores themes of love, identity, and the power of storytelling. The book has received widespread acclaim, and it's wonderful to see it resonating with readers like you!

A hybrid approach to organizing your bookshelves is a great idea. It'll allow you to appreciate your books from different perspectives, and it can be a fun way to discover new connections between authors and genres. Remember, the most important thing is to create a system that makes sense to you and brings you joy every time you browse your shelves.

If you don't mind me asking, what was it about "The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo" that resonated with you? Was it the characters, the storytelling, the themes, or something else entirely?

Also, have you explored Taylor Jenkins Reid's other works, such as "Maybe in Another Life" or "After I Do"?
